ngiemboon: Púʼu la, pege kwaʼ ńgẅiin léké ńkúʼte nò gie pege la júʼ kuʼté, tà á té púʼu wɔ́, mbà pege ge fʉa mánzsè, é gʉa pyé,
en: For this reason, we must pay attention all the more to what we have heard, so that we will not drift away.

ngiemboon: pege ne ńzsé ngie, anò gie mecÿɔ́ʼ Ssé la lɔg ńtó fʉ̀ʼʉmvfò, á la te méjʉʼʉ nò wɔ́. Wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn fʉa yɛ̌ nò, ńtʉʉ twó mǒ wɔ́ɔ, e Ssé lɔ̌ɔn ńnéŋe ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ na yé pɔ́ na páʼ á ne ńzɛ́te.
en: For if the message spoken through angels was legally binding  ,# 2:2 Dt 33:2; Ac 7:53; Heb 1:1 and every transgression and disobedience received a just punishment,  # 2:2 Nm 15:30; Heb 10:28

ngiemboon: Páʼ á laa púʼu la, pege lɔɔn ńgwágte nò na máamáa nò gẅie aa páʼ e Ssé la gÿo pege tsẅɛ́, e Ssé gǎa tà ńnyé wégè? Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô lé twó yé la vɔg ńzye létsẅii yɛ̌ nò. Epʉ̀a pie é la júʼu ncwò yé, é gÿo ńkwaʼ shwóŋo wégè ngie aa kwàʼ máamáa nò.
en: how will we escape if we neglect such a great salvation?   This salvation had its beginning when it was spoken of by the Lord, and it was confirmed to us by those who heard him.  # 2:3 Lk 1:2; Heb 1:2; 10:29

ngiemboon: E Ssé gíŋ ńtóonte wɔ́b na nò gie pɔ́ ne ńgɔɔn, ńcʉa na meliŋé, pâ menò mɔɔnmɔɔn, pâ mendàagyá mentí mentí, ńgíŋ ńcʉa na mefàʼ mie à zába na we lekwoŋ ngie Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ge gÿo pʉ̀a kuʼu léfaʼ.
en: At the same time, God also testified by signs and wonders, various miracles, and distributions of gifts from the Holy Spirit according to his will.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la zɔɔn te gÿo ngie mecÿɔ́ʼ pé gẅiin nò na lesǎʼ ngwòŋ gẅie é ne ńtóo wɔ́, é ngwòŋ gẅie pege ne ńgɔɔn nò mǒ.
en: For he has not subjected to angels the world to come that we are talking about.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ la zɔɔn ńŋweʼe mmó na yɔɔn nò á tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ jʉʼʉ Ŋwàʼne Ssé ngie:
Ɔ̀ la gʉa na páʼ mecÿɔ́ʼ Ssé gwɔ́, ésẅíʼi yé ńnáa ssé pɔ́ méjʉʼ
en: You made him lower than the angels

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ la lɔgɔ yé ńgÿo nyìŋ gẅie à sáʼa shúm ntsèm sie ɔ̀ la nyɛte,
en: and subjected everything under his feet.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, ammó gie pege ne ńgyá fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie Yěsô gẅie e Ssé la sẅíʼi yé ńnáa ssé tà mecÿɔ́ʼ Ssé cʉa yé pɔ́ méjʉʼ, e Ssé leen ńtɔʼɔ cÿɔ̀ʼɔ lefùɔ twó yé, á gie á gÿo á gẅiin legúʼ, ḿbiŋ ńnéŋ mekùʼ mé, mélàʼmie à la zẅíŋe légyá ngɔ́ʼ tà ńkwé. Yěsô lɔ̌ɔn ńkwé na twó pʉ̀a mesoŋ ntsèm, á fóo pɔ́ na páʼ e Ssé tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe pʉ̀a tɛʼ.
en: But we do see Jesus #— #made lower than the angels for a short time so that by God’s grace he might taste death   for everyone #— #crowned with glory and honor   # 2:9 Ac 2:33; 3:13 because he suffered death.  # 2:9 Jn 3:16; 2Co 5:15; Php 2:9

ngiemboon: E Ssé la gÿo shúm ntsèm sie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó é gwɔ́ wó, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ shúm sé. Páʼ à la piŋ ńne ńkwoŋo ngie pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ge cʉ́ʼ púɔ pé, é gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ legúʼ we la, Yěsô zɔ̌ piŋ ńgẅiin légÿo pɔ́ tsẅɛ́ la, á la ne ńzɛ́te ngie à gÿo Yěsô fó na ngɔ́ʼ gie à gyǎ, ńkuʼu nyìŋ gẅie à ge gÿo pɔ́ tsẅɛ́.
en: For in bringing many sons and daughters to glory, it was entirely appropriate that God #— #for whom and through whom all things exist #— #should make the pioneer   of their salvation perfect through sufferings.  # 2:10 Lk 13:32; 24:26; Rm 11:36; Heb 7:28

ngiemboon: Yěsô gẅie à gÿo epʉ̀a gwɔ́ ndʉalʉ̌a mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie à gÿǒ pɔ́ gwɔ́ ndʉalʉ̌a, pâ pɔ̌ pú ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a tàʼ nyìŋ. Áa mmó gie á gÿo eshʉ́ té kúu yé létóŋo wɔ́b lê mefɛ̌ pé wɔ́.
en: For the one who sanctifies and those who are sanctified all have one Father.   That is why Jesus is not ashamed to call them brothers and sisters,  # 2:11 Mt 28:10; Jn 20:17; Ac 17:28; Heb 10:10

ngiemboon: À la zɔɔn ńgɔɔn mbwó Ssé ngie:

en: Again, I will trust in him.    And again, Here I am with the children God gave me.   # 2:13 Is 8:18 LXX,# 2:13 Ps 18:2; Is 8:17–18; 12:2; Jn 10:29; 17:6

ngiemboon: Páʼ yɔɔn gubé ŋwɛ́ pú ńgẅiin mbab nnɛ́ mbɔɔ metse la, kwàʼ yé máŋwɛ́ la gíŋ ńgwɔ́ yé pɔ́ púʼu, légwɔ́ gie à ge lɔgɔ legwé we, é gÿo tà nyìŋ gẅie à kɔ́ɔn ńgÿo epʉ̀a kwéte, á le gíŋ ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́. Mé gɔɔn páʼɔɔn á Sátà.
en: Now since the children have flesh and blood in common, Jesus also shared in these, so that through his death he might destroy the one holding the power of death #— #that is, the devil    #— #

ngiemboon: É piŋ gÿo epʉ̀a pie lepɔgɔ́ legwé leen ḿbú ńkwɛ́ɛ wɔb legwɔ́ wó, e tsẅɛ́.
en: and free those who were held in slavery all their lives by the fear of death.

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ kwàʼ nénʉ́ ngie Yěsô la te tó lékẅéte mecÿɔ́ʼ Ssé wɔ́, à la tóo lékẅéte pʉ̀a ngẅɛ̀ ndá Ábalaham.
en: For it is clear that he does not reach out to help angels, but to help Abraham’s offspring.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á la gÿo, á sele ńcʉ́ʼ ńgwɔ́ yé pɔ́ páʼ mefɛ̌ pé, tá ńdɔg ńgwɔ́ nùŋepwɔʼ wɔb welÿò gẅie à gẅiin pòŋontʉ́m mbɔɔ pyennɛ́ lélɔg faʼa mbwó Ssé, ńgíŋ ńdɔg ḿvéle mefʉa pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: Therefore, he had to be like his brothers and sisters in every way, so that he could become a merciful and faithful high priest in matters   pertaining to God, to make atonement  # 2:17 Or propitiation,# 2:17 2Co 5:21 for the sins of the people.  # 2:17 Lk 18:13; Rm 3:25; Php 2:7; Heb 4:15; 5:1–2; 7:26–28; 1Jn 2:2; 4:10

ngiemboon: Legwɔ́ gẅie mé la kwaʼte Yěsô, á gyá ngɔ́ʼ, à la gÿo á kuʼu lékẅéte pʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ nkwàʼte.
en: For since he himself has suffered when he was tempted, he is able to help those who are tempted.
